en.purpose: To apply Rome IV criteria for diagnosing functional biliary pain, ensuring uniform clinical decision-making and avoiding unnecessary cholecystectomy or invasive interventions.
en.use:
Patients with recurrent right upper quadrant (RUQ) or epigastric pain with normal gallbladder ultrasound and no structural biliary disease.

The clinician assesses the patient against the following Rome IV criteria:

Episodic, severe pain in the right upper quadrant (RUQ) or epigastrium.

Pain lasts at least 30 minutes and is not relieved by postural changes, antacids, or bowel movements.

Pain disrupts daily activities or requires medical consultation.

No evidence of gallstones, duct obstruction, or other structural disease on imaging.
en.misuse:
Not to be used for diagnosing biliary pain caused by gallstones, cholecystitis, or malignancy.

Not a substitute for clinical judgment, alternative diagnoses should be ruled out.
